name: Kuntur GNU-Linux
short_description:
Kuntur GNU-Linux is a light weight distribution based on Ubuntu Mini Remix 14.04.1 LTS (32bit).
The purpose of Kuntur GNU-Linux is to provide a tool for learning Quechua (Runasimi) language, and hopefully, in the future, a completely quechua-localized environment.

Kuntur GNU-Linux is based on Ubuntu Mini Remix and should run both on PCs and Netbooks. 

It also combines a set of applications already localized in Quecha: a text editor, an image viewer, a music player and of course, tk-yupana (check it in my project list); for other applications the work is in progress.

The goal of the distribution is to create a user-friendly desktop system and a useful live CD for everyone who wants to study Quechua and for quechua-native tongue users who wants to use a friendly environment.
summary: GNU-Linux light weight distro with Quechua localization
